result.execSummary:
The defendant Tyler Nickolas Fanis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with 13CF574, consecutive to sentence now serving.

superMiscConds.notes: DOC collect.  If extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
$528 costs--DOC to collect within first 6 months of release onto extended supervision.

records.addlTxt:
IT IS ORDERED that the Department of Corrections will effectuate the change from Confinement to Extended Supervision upon receipt of this order, determining the actual number of days served in Confinement and changing the remaining Confinement to Extended Supervision. The number of days that are converted from Confinement Time to Extended Supervision will be determined by a DOC records office staff member and will be based upon actual release Date.
IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the Warden/Superintendent of the institution to which the prisoner is assigned shall effect his or her release upon receipt of this order.
defendant completed Earned Release Program; Amendment to Judgment of Conviction attached, converting balance of incarceration time to extended supervision

Defendant Tyler Nickolas Fanis in court in custody with attorney Michael Shannon Murphy.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court orders:  3 years WSP and 3 years extended supervision, concurrent with 13CF574 and consecutive to sentence now serving; DOC to collect restitution; DOC to collect $528 costs within first 6 months of release onto extended supervision; no sentence credit; eligible for prison programs.  Felon warnings given.
